intro: Oxytropis heteropoda, commonly known as the broadleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It often grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Oxytropis heteropoda plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
